blockquote.p:
description: Patients with a history of colorectal cancer should begin colonoscopy surveillance 1 year pos-resection.
Repeat colonoscopy 3 years after 1st surveillance, and every 5 years thereafter. Post-polypectomy surveillance intervals apply if shorter.
Refer to patient's oncologic treatment team of survivorship care plan for patient-specific guidance.

tr.td: Colonoscopy Surveillance after Colorectal Cancer Resection: Recommendations of the US Multi-Society Task Force on Colorectal Cancer

div.p: Kahi, C. J., et al. (2016). Colonoscopy Surveillance after Colorectal Cancer Resection: Recommendations of the US Multi-Society Task Force on Colorectal Cancer. Gastroenterology, 150(3), 758-768.e11. https://doi.org/10.1053/j.gastro.2016.01.001

tr.td: USMSTF Follow-Up After Colonoscopy and Polypectomy (2020)
Recommendations for Follow-Up After Colonoscopy and Polypectomy: A Consensus Update by the US Multi-Society Task Force on Colorectal Cancer

div.p: Gupta, S., et al. (2020). Recommendations for Follow-Up After Colonoscopy and Polypectomy: A Consensus Update by the US Multi-Society Task Force on Colorectal Cancer. Gastroenterology, 158(4), 1131–1153.e5. https://doi.org/10.1053/j.gastro.2019.10.026

description.value:
Patients with a history of colorectal cancer should begin colonoscopy surveillance 1 year pos-resection.
Repeat colonoscopy 3 years after 1st surveillance, and every 5 years thereafter. Post-polypectomy surveillance intervals apply if shorter.
Refer to patient's oncologic treatment team of survivorship care plan for patient-specific guidance.

reasonCode: History of malignant neoplasm of cecum and/or colon and/or rectum (situation)
